titleStmt.title: Henry Akman et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9165

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency B Magoffin Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The Undersigned your petitioners would respectfully represent that at the November term of the Grant Circuit Court for 1861 Emanuel Deitz was convicted of Shooting one Frances Landrum with the intent to kill and was sentenced to Confinement in the penitentiary of this Commonwealth for the term of four years. that he has ever since been confined in the sd penitentiary your petitioners would further represent that said Emanuel Deitz has a wife and seven children -- he has five small children who are unable to perform any labor for a support -- he has one son and one daughter who are able to work his wife and family are very poor and stand greatly in need of the his services in making a support for his said family -- your petitioners believe that should said Deitz be released he will in future be a good law abiding citizen they think his case such as to warrant the interposition of your exellency clemency

Wherefore your petitioners pray your Excellency to release the said Deitz from
further confinement in the penitentiary under said Sentence that he may be restored to his family and society

Henry Akman
Daniel Harrison
T J Harrison
Dudley Starry
David D Shyrer
Wm Markesberry
Al markesberry
F Jacobs
W Jacobs
H Markesburry

Pardon Issd
